SrgsRuleRef Class

Definition

Represents the grammar element that specifies a reference to a rule.

In this Article

[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
public class SrgsRuleRef : System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsElement
Inheritance
Object
MarshalByRefObject
SrgsElement
SrgsRuleRef
Attributes
ImmutableObjectAttribute DebuggerDisplayAttribute

Inherited Members

Remarks

The SrgsRuleRef class is particularly useful when you want to reuse an SrgsRule element whose contents have already been defined. By reusing existing rules, you can build complex grammars more quickly.

You can use one of the constructors of the SrgsRuleRef class to reference an SrgsRule object or a rule element if the following is true:

  • The SrgsRule object is in the containing grammar and the value of its Scope property is SrgsRuleScope or SrgsRuleScope.

  • The rule element is in an external grammar and the value of its scope attribute is public.

  • The rule element is in an external grammar, the value of its scope attribute is private, and it is declared as the root rule of the external grammar.

This class represents the ruleref element as defined in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) Version 1.0. For information about the SRGS ruleref element and details about its support by System.Speech, see ruleref Element.

Constructors

SrgsRuleRef(SrgsRule)

Initializes a new instance of the SrgsRuleRef class and specifies the rule to reference.

public SrgsRuleRef (System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule rule);
Parameters
rule
SrgsRule

The object to reference.

Attributes
ImmutableObjectAttribute DebuggerDisplayAttribute
Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

rule is null.

Remarks

This constructor creates a rule reference to an SrgsRule object within the containing grammar. To create a rule reference to a rule element in an external grammar file, use any of the following constructors:

  • SrgsRuleRef
  • SrgsRuleRef
  • SrgsRuleRef
  • SrgsRuleRef(Uri, String, String, String)

SrgsRuleRef(Uri)

Initializes a new instance of the SrgsRuleRef class and specifies the location of the external grammar file to reference.

public SrgsRuleRef (Uri uri);
Parameters
uri
Uri

The location of a grammar file outside the containing grammar.

Attributes
ImmutableObjectAttribute DebuggerDisplayAttribute
Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

uri is null.

Remarks

This constructor creates a rule reference to an external grammar file. The URI may also include the identifier of a rule to reference, for example http://www.contoso.com/ExternalGrammar.grxml#targetRule. If the uri parameter does not specify a rule identifier, the rule reference points to the root rule of the target grammar. To create a rule reference to an SrgsRule object within the same grammar, use any of the following constructors:

  • SrgsRuleRef
  • SrgsRuleRef
  • SrgsRuleRef

Fields

Dictation

Defines a rule that can match spoken input as defined by the dictation topic associated with this grammar.

public static readonly System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRuleRef Dictation;
Attributes
ImmutableObjectAttribute DebuggerDisplayAttribute

Garbage

Defines a rule that can match any speech up to the next rule match, the next token, or until the end of spoken input.

public static readonly System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRuleRef Garbage;
Attributes
ImmutableObjectAttribute DebuggerDisplayAttribute

MnemonicSpelling

Indicates that speech input can contain spelled-out letters of a word, and that spelled-out letters can be recognized as a word.

public static readonly System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRuleRef MnemonicSpelling;
Attributes
ImmutableObjectAttribute DebuggerDisplayAttribute

Null

Defines a rule that is automatically matched in the absence of any audio input.

public static readonly System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRuleRef Null;
Attributes
ImmutableObjectAttribute DebuggerDisplayAttribute

Void

Defines a rule that can never be spoken. Inserting VOID into a sequence automatically makes that sequence unspeakable.

public static readonly System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRuleRef Void;
Attributes
ImmutableObjectAttribute DebuggerDisplayAttribute
